M

main(String[]) - Static method in class ChatBot
The main method, creates an instance of ChatBot using console arguments as input for portString and address ("14001" and "localhost" are defaults respectively) and calls the go method
main(String[]) - Static method in class ChatClient
The main method, creates an instance of ChatClient using console arguments as input for portString and address ("14001" and "localhost" are defaults respectively) and calls the go method
main(String[]) - Static method in class ChatServer
The main method, creates an instance of ChatServer using console arguments as input for portString ("14001" as default) and calls the go method
main(String[]) - Static method in class DoDClient
The main method, creates an instance of DoDClient using console arguments as input for portString and address ("14001" and "localhost" are defaults respectively) and calls the go method
mainLoop() - Method in class ChatBot
Keeps reading the data received from the server, and replying to the server with a random response from a predetermined list of responses if a key word is contained in the data received.
mainLoop() - Method in class DoDClient
Keeps reading the data received from the server, processing the data and if necessary then replying to the server This only stops if an IOException is thrown (if the server is forcibly closed) or if the serverMsg is null, which occurs if the server closed peacefully.
mainLoop() - Method in class ServerUserInput
Keeps reading the user's input until they enter exit, at which point the server is shut down cleanly and the loop is broken from.
manhattanDistance(Coordinate, Coordinate) - Method in class BotPlayer
Takes in the bot's and human's coordinates and returns the manhattan distance between them.
manhattanSearch(HashMap<String, Coordinate>, ArrayList<Coordinate>) - Method in class BotPlayer
Loops through each of the valid directions and checks through all the humans on the cropped map for the manhattan distance from them, then returns the move which gets the bot closest to a human.
map - Variable in class GameLogic
Represents the map of the game
map - Variable in class Map
ArrayList of strings which represents the maps.
Map - Class in <Unnamed>
This class contains the map information, including the map name, gold required to win, and the map structure.
Map(int) - Constructor for class Map
The constructor receives the minimum number of spaces the map should accomodate for (for placing bots and players)
mapName - Variable in class Map
String representing the map name
maxArgNum - Variable in class Command
Maximum number of arguments the command is allowed to receive.
maxMoveWithoutLook - Variable in class BotPlayer
Integer representing the maximum number of moves the bot should make before looking
MessageType - Enum in <Unnamed>
Represents the type of message that should be sent
MessageType() - Constructor for enum MessageType
 
minArgNum - Variable in class Command
Minimum number of arguments the command is allowed to receive
minimumRequiredNumOfSpaces - Variable in class Map
Integer representing the minimum number of spawnable spaces the map should contain
move(List<String>) - Method in class GameLogic
Receives a list of arguments (of length 1) and tries to move the player in the corresponding direction they asked
moveDirection() - Method in class BotPlayer
Decides whether the bot should do a manhattan search or move randomly based on whether a human is visible or not, and then return the move decided upon using the method decided
moveWithoutLook - Variable in class BotPlayer
Integer representing the number of moves the bot has done without looking
mySocket - Variable in class ChatServer
ServerSocket representing the server which is used to accept the client connections
